title: Electric potential can one get E from map of V

content.question: A student is given a diagram of equally spaced equipotential lines along with the values of the potentials for a region of space. Which of the following indicates whether it is possible for the student to create an electric field vector map in the same region of space and provides a valid justification?

choices.label: No, because electric field lines and equipotential lines are independent representations.
No, because the zero point for electric potential is not known it is not possible to uniquely determine the electric field.
Yes, because the electric field is everywhere directed at a right angle to an isoline, with a magnitude that is inversely proportional to the spacing between adjacent isolines.
Yes, because the electric field everywhere points along an isoline, with a magnitude that is directly related to the value of the potential on the isoline.

content.answer: Yes, because the electric field is everywhere directed at a right angle to an isoline, with a magnitude that is inversely proportional to the spacing between adjacent isolines.

skill.text: 3.C: Justify or support a claim using evidence from experimental data, physical representations, or physical principles or laws.
